messages.title: Welcoming Apprenticeship Opportunities
messages.content: Increasing the level of housebuilding both in Durham and across the country is very important to Roberta, as it is an important way of providing more homes for local people and also bringing much-needed jobs into the area. Apprenticeships can play a huge role in this, both in terms of providing local people with the skills they need and also ensuring that those who are perhaps going down a vocational route through their working life are able to get the on-the-job training and experience this is so crucial to securing employment.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Supporting local businesses by highlighting the importance of supporting local businesses, especially the need for education and training providers to use this firm.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Supporting Industry in the North East
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Highlighting the importance of processes industries in the North East and working to support smaller companies and promote more business interaction and partnerships.
Campaigning for the rights of BHS workers who lost their jobs following the collapse of BHS, pushing for fair treatment of former employees who lost their pensions.
Worked with local Councillors to reopen the Kelloe Post Office, which had been much needed by local residents.
Attended events to support North Durham Parkinson’s Support Group to raise awareness of the disease and improve the quality of life for people with Parkinson’s.
After smoking obesity is the biggest cause of cancer and is linked to 18,100 cancers in the UK every year. Campaigning for better measures to tackle obesity and support Cancer Research UK.
Supporting initiatives to improve the quality and uptake of healthy school meals, including cooking lessons.
Campaigning for local charities and securing funding for projects such as TSB presenting a £500 cheque for Durham Hospital Radio.
Highlighting the effect of Brexit on the higher education sector and working to ensure that it does not negatively impact the higher education sector in Durham.

issues.brexitEurope: Highlighting the effect of Brexit on the higher education sector and ensuring it does not negatively impact the higher education sector in Durham.
issues.economy: Supporting local businesses and industry in the North East, highlighting the importance of processes industries.
issues.education: Championing school meals, supporting initiatives to improve the quality and uptake of healthy school meals, including cooking lessons.
issues.health: Raising awareness of Parkinson’s Disease, supporting Cancer Research UK, championing school meals.
issues.labourEmployment: Supporting BHS workers who lost their jobs following the collapse of BHS.
